json.text: Hi! today I will tell you the history of Thanksgiving
It is a big family holiday in The United States and Canada
And it happens at the beginning of so called holiday  season
Because in the next month we have Christmas, Hanukkah, New Year
And all sorts of holidays
It is a national holiday In the US and Canada, and it happens as a day of giving thanks for the previous year
For the harvest and for everything that people got during the year.
But in Canada people celebrate Thanksgiving on second Monday of October,
and In The US, it is on the last Thursday of November
The history of this holiday goes back to 16th century
In England at that time there was a Protestant Reformation of church
Church of England was separeted from Roman Catholic church
And there was a movement of Puritans, who didn't like the new church, and the new way
everything was made
And one day they decided to leave the country and they moved to Holland
At that time they had a religious tradition of Days of Fasting and Days of Thanksgiving
So on days of fasting they were doing nothing, they weren't eating, weren't celebrating anything
they were just praying to God
and at the days of Thanksgiving they were
again, praying to god and kind of celebrating what the God gave them
They still had this tradition and then, when pilgrims moved to Holland from England they have met a tradition
of european harvest festival, which is now called Oktoberfest
And then, they've decided to go to the new land
A new land was America, so the got on a ship called Mayflower and swam across the Atlantic Ocean to
the North Ameica
So people that decided to go to new land we called Pilgrims
And that happened at 1620
so they came to America and they called the place that they came to  - Plymouth
and it was around November, so it was cold and scary
so they built a settlement, survived winter and they had nothing, so they had to grow everything
build their houses, and  next autumn 1621, they decided to celebrate their first harvest on the new land
So here we have first American Thanksgiving, which comes from a lot of traditions
because if you look at other cultures there are definetely harvest festivals around this time of year
because it is the time of the harvest
So combining all of these traditions, the religious tradition, the harvest festival tradition, and
They had their first Thanksgiving
So they were giving thanks to God, to Indians that helped them
to themselves, to each other for their survival, for the harvest they have gathered
and for everything that they had. They made it. They moved to the new land
So they had a feast for 3 days, there was a lot of food, a little bit different from today's traditional
foods for Thanksgiving
but still, it was a first Thanksgiving
It became a national holiday 200 years later
and now Americans and Canadians celebrate it every year
So the idea of Thanksgiving is being thankful for what you have
Religious people thank God, not religious people thank each other and just
in general, being thankful for the food they have, the family they have and just everything
And I really like this holiday, because it has very positive energy
being thankful is great. It is the best feeling
Today Thanksgiving is also all about the family, all about gathering all the family around the table
And Eating. yeah
This holiday is all about food
The traditional Thanksgiving dinner cosists of : Turkey
The main course of Thanksgiving is turkey
roasted seasonal vegetables like pumpkin, squash, turnip
anything really
Gravy, cranberry sauce
pumpkin pie, and
these are traditional ones but there are many many more
people usually make gigantic amounts of food and just suff themselves with food
But it is asossiated with family, positivity, being thankful, greatful and...good things
but I don't think that eating too much is a good thing
As I said thnksgiving starts the holiday season, so it is the best time for retailers
Because people start buying gifts for New Year, for Christmas, and all sorts of holidays, and it is just business time
Also in America they have parade, Thanksgiving parade, where they recreate The First Thanksgiving
Thay dress like Pilgrims and yeah
so the bottom line is That on this holiday, people are being thankful, they are being greatful
for what they have. They show their appreciation
for what they have earned,for  people they have around them, for the family
and just for everything. they take time to sit down , all together and and appreciate each other
If thnksgiving is not a national holiday in your country, you still can take this message
and think about things you are grateful for
I hope it was interesting. It is just a quick story of thnksgiving
If you wanna learn more, google it, because there are a lot of information about the history and how
it became a national holiday and things like that. I just gave you a short story
So I have a good day, and I will see you later, Bye!)
AS  much as I enjoy thnksgiving,
the beginning of holiday season actually gives me  a lot of anxiety
because
there were a lot of disappointing and sad things happening to me around New Year time
for the last 4 years
so I am kinda not looking forward to that
yeah
well I hope this year will be fine
